column1: 2024-10-03T23:59:24Z,7622,,AI SC,,newgraph_airvine,7622,newgraph_airvine,,111,Burnt Cabin Creek,Stella Road,,MoTI,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.15,30,Very large outlet drop indicating that culvert is undersized for current flow volumes. Habitat confirmation completed downstream and upstream as well as below gala Bay Road.          ,,2024-10-03,10,388735,5997152,No,,,No,,2.2,1.15,0.43,No,5,2,5,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_airvine,2,1,1,4,"Erosion on the outlet of the pipe is quite severe with a lot of downcutting and huge outlet pool. General itâ€™s in good condition, including the road prism.          ",3,2,6,10,"Pipe appears to be quite undersized because of the size of the outlet shop and the outlet pool. There are some recreational properties, downstream and small cabins and one unpaid road that could be affected by a blowout.          ",,1,8,5,10,8,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_170240.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_171402.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_170251.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_171407.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_170242.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_170248.jpg,,,,,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-03T21:25:18Z,,5400202,LS ,,newgraph_lschick,5400202,newgraph_lschick,,396,Tributary to Fraser Lake ,Gala bay road ,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.05,11.5,"Local name of stream is Burnt Cabin Creek. Nice dream with a huge outlet drop. Outlet pool is quite big and eroded indicating the culvert is under size for the size of the stream. Low traffic dirt road with not much Phil, so construction would be relatively easy.

,,2024-10-03,10,388944,5997001,No,,,No,,0.5,0.9,0.35,No,7,3.1,3,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,1,2,1,4,Pipe is in good condition. Outlet pool is quite big and eroded, especially underneath of the pipe, indicating the culvert is very undersized for the size of the stream.          ",3,3,9,13,"Culvert is very undersized for the size of the stream, a flood could very likely wash out the road because there is not much fill.          ",1,8,9,9,0,5,32,45,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_143200.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_145410.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_143213.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_143208.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_143202.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_143211.jpg,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_145735.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241003_143217.jpg,,Local name ,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-04T16:44:03Z,,5400203,AI,,newgraph_airvine,5400203,newgraph_airvine,,112,Scotch Creek,Stella Road,,MoTi ,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.1,25,Good amount of flow for this time of year. Adjacent landowners report that this stream was previously used as a source of water that was bottled and distributed throughout the province. Culvert is likely very undersized as evidenced by the large outlet drop.     Habitat confirmation assessment completed upstream and downstream               ,,2024-10-04,10,388269,5996948,No,,,No,,4,1.35,0.28,No,5,2,0,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_airvine,4,1,1,6,Pipe is very bent left to right for the bottom 2/3 with upper side of pipe bent up for the top 6 m or so. Massive amount of erosion at the old outlet with very large outlet drop Indic is very under for the stream.          ,4,2,8,14,Large sizer outlet drop indicates that pipe is undersized for the stream so could be overwhelmed with major runoff and precipitation events. Downstream there are some recreational residences that could be affected.          ,1,1,3,4,10,8,27,41,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_095834.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_095841.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_095849.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_095844.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_095837.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_095847.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_095910.jpg,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_100157.jpg,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-04T17:39:14Z,,5400201,AI,,newgraph_airvine,5400201,newgraph_airvine,,113,Scotch Creek,Gala Bay Road,,MoTi,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.4,13," Two fully embedded PVC pipes at 0.7 m each. One of the pipes is 100% back watered. Extensive gravel, upstream and downstream with historic Chinnook point recorded adjacent to the road.          ",,2024-10-04,10,388380,5996779,Yes,0.35,Yes,Yes,100,1.5,0,0.1,No,0.5,2,1.5,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_airvine,1,1,1,3,Relatively new structures in good condition and no evidence of issues at the road          ,1,1,1,4,Large amount of embedment could indicate that overtime the pipes may have the potential to become clogged and require maintenance to avoid washing out the road.          ,1,5,8,8,10,9,41,45,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_104951.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_105003.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_105016.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_105010.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_104955.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_105013.jpg,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_105257.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_105022.jpg,,Barrel2,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-04T17:13:41Z,,2024100450,LS ,,newgraph_lschick,2024100450,newgraph_lschick,,399,Scotch creek ,Private drive ,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.05,7.5,"Two pipes, one at 0.6 and one at 0.45 m in diameter. Decent outlet drop and water is only flowing through the bigger of the two pipes. The road on the inlet side has completely eroded into the stream visibly blocking The view of the inlet. Cannot see any light at the end of the culverts from the outlet side, but water is able to flow still. Landowner has put a barricade across the road likely to stop people because the road is so eroded. Nice with really good habitat, lots of large wood debris, creating pools. Gravel present and suitable for spawning fish. Just downstream of the culvert is a water intake shack located in the middle of the stream that was heard functioning during the time of survey. Likely used by the adjacent landowners whose house you can see from the stream. Plastic pipes also seen in the stream from the water intake shack down to the lower crossing on Stella Road. Road seems very overgrown and doesnâ€™t really lead to anywhere so would be a good candidate for removing the road. Culvert length and slope estimated because I could not locate the inlet of the pipes due to erosion of road. ",,2024-10-04,10,388199,5997060,No,,,No,,2,0.7,0.55,No,2,2.5,4,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,5,2,3,10,"Roadbed is completely eroded into the stream on the inlet side, completely blocking site of the inlet. Road looks overgrown and doesnâ€™t look like it leads to anywhere so could be a good candidate for removing the road completely.          ",2,2,4,14,Flood would likely just wash out the road due to the inlet being covered by erosion debris.           ,1,10,10,10,0,5,36,50,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103356.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103818.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103431.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103422.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103400.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103426.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103459.jpg,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103854.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103531.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_103538.jpg,Road,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-04T19:41:22Z,,15600285,LS ,,newgraph_lschick,15600285,newgraph_lschick,,401,Nine mile Creek          ,Settlement Road          ,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,3.2,11.5,"Inletâ€™s of both culverts are damned inside by the beaver backing up the water to most of the height of the culvert. Two pipes at 1.6 m in diameter. Each. Massive outlet pool, indicating the size of the pipes are likely undersized for the size of the stream. Another beaver dam being constructed at the outlet of the outlet pool. Not much fail and dirt Road so construction would be fairly easy. I believe the road is used for pipeline use. Outlet pool depth estimated because too deep to wade into. Fish observed during habitat, confirmation downstream roughly 40 mm in length           ",,2024-10-04,10,403906,5998777,No,,,No,,0.5,0.5,1.4,No,2,5.5,0.5,Yes,Yes,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,2,1,3,6,Erosion under outlet of pipes. Both pipes are blocked by Beaver dams with only 10 to 25% of the culvert visible from the inlet side.          ,1,3,3,9,"Massive outlet pool, indicating the pipes are likely undersized for the size of the stream. Due to the beaver dam blockage inside the pipes a flood could likely wash out the road.          ",2,5,8,8,10,5,38,47,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_124211.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125650.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125711.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125656.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125642.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125659.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125757.jpg,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125727.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_140629.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125807.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_125738.jpg,Massive outlet pool          ,Beaverdam blockage          ,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-04T22:42:28Z,,15600119,LS ,,newgraph_lschick,15600119,newgraph_lschick,,403,Clear creek ,Hwy 27 ,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.85,28,"Bottom of culvert has been reinforced with concrete, supposedly to fix the holes mentioned in the previous assessment. Outlet of culvert has a huge pile of rip wrap perhaps to reduce the lead drop but seems a bit odd and perhaps might inhibit fish passage. really nice habitat, nice big pool just downstream of the culvert and lots of gravel present for spawning fish.          ",,2024-10-04,10,425557,5996165,No,,,No,,3,1,0.2,No,3,0,0,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,1,1,1,3,Culvert is in good condition as the bottom has been reinforced with concrete recently. No erosion or blockage issues.          ,1,5,5,8,"Culvert is very large and size of outlet pool indicates that stream probably has high flows at certain times of year. Unlikely a flood would affect the culvert, but if so, it would wash out the highway.          ",10,2,1,1,10,5,29,37,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_155429.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_155436.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_155452.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_155440.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_155432.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_155448.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_155834.jpg,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_160219.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_155459.jpg,,Riprap,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-04T23:29:32Z,,15606280,LS,,newgraph_lschick,15606280,newgraph_lschick,,404,Clear creek ,Private drive ,,,Open Bottom Structure,Bridge,,10,2.4,"Bridge over clear Creek. Looks like itâ€™s used to connect someoneâ€™s private land

2024-10-04T23:43:19Z,,15602083,LS,,newgraph_lschick,15602083,newgraph_lschick,,405,Clear creek,Private rd,,,Open Bottom Structure,Ford,,,,,,2024-10-04,10,425630,5995920,No,,,No,,,0,0,No,0,0,0,No,No,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_164457.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_164503.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_164514.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_164505.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_164500.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241004_164512.jpg,,,,,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-05T17:51:31Z,,9902577,LS,,newgraph_lschick,9902577,newgraph_lschick,,407,Beaverley creek ,Hwy 16,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Oval Culvert,,5.6,25,"Two pipes at 2.8 m in diameter each. Pipe on the north side is not flowing. Gradient directly below, the culvert are 3 to 4% due to boulders being placed to create back watering, which is somewhat functioning, but the culverts are not back watered, but the water is definitely higher. The rest of the stream has a gradient of 0.5%. Nice dream with good habitat, fairly channelized due to it running due to residence on both sides,. Stream show signs of high flows with eroding banks. Not many pools or functional large debris.            ",,2024-10-05,10,502374,5962501,No,,,No,,1.5,1.05,0.35,No,2,9.6,0.5,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,1,1,1,3,"No blockage or fill issues. Looks like there may have been erosion under the outlet of the North pipe, which has been reinforced with some foam substance. See photos.          ",1,3,3,6,"Massive culverts and only one has flow, a flood would likely not affect the culverts, but this is a highway crossing so consequences would be high.          ",10,1,1,1,10,5,28,34,Highway crossing so construction would be expensive and difficult. Known  chinnook point on stream. ,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_110617.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_110627.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_110636.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_110630.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_110623.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_110633.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_110646.jpg,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_121708.jpg,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-05T19:47:25Z,,9902948,LS,,newgraph_lschick,9902948,newgraph_lschick,,409,Tributary to Beaverley creek ,Muralt rd,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,0.8,17,"Culvert is fully back, watered with the outlet completely submerged. Stream flows through grassy Valley on someoneâ€™s property upstream. Road column on inlet side is eroding significantly. Fence positioned in front of the inlet in V shape, not sure why. Calvert slope and length estimated Due to the inlet being completely submerged and basically not visible.  Culvert is embedded at the inlet and assuming full embedment, but cannot confirm due to outlet being completely submerged.  Just upstream of inlet is the remnants of perhaps an old damn, big piles of dirt on each side. Now it has the middle dugout to allow the stream to flow down. See photos.          ",,2024-10-05,10,506082,5962275,Yes,0.1,Yes,Yes,100,7,0,0.5,No,1,1.8,3,No,No,Deep Fill,Low,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,1,2,2,5,Road column on inlet side is completely eroding. 6 to 7 m of Phil. Culbert full backwater but passable.           ,2,2,4,9,"Lots of fill on top of culvert, so sled would not affect the road, but the road column is already eroding on the right side.          ",2,1,5,7,2,5,22,31,"Country paved road with lots of fill so construction would be expensive. stream flows into beaverley creek, which is a known fish brain stream. So construction could have environmental impacts.          ",ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130004.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130120.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130033.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130024.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130007.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130028.jpg,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130044.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130050.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_132102.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130053.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241005_130742.jpg,V-fence,Old dam,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

May have been here last year and dry, but not sure.  Habitat confirmation conducted. Upstream is low gradient gravel system with mature rep Ryan and state banks.                     ",,2024-10-07,10,578677,5973049,No,,,No,,1,0.1,0.15,No,3,0,0,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_airvine,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_163138.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_163145.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_163202.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_163151.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_163141.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_163154.jpg,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_163954.jpg,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-07T17:39:51Z,,13903184,LS ,,newgraph_lschick,13903184,newgraph_lschick,,410,Kenneth creek ,,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Oval Culvert,,5.5,30,Multi plate round culvert. Call Vert slope estimated. Massive culvert with an even bigger outlet pool probably 50 m wide. Stream was just pumping during time of survey. Outlet pool depth estimated because pool was too deep to wait into.                               ,,2024-10-07,10,582279,5975090,No,,,No,,1.5,0.7,2,No,1,19,0.5,No,No,Deep Fill,High,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,3,2,1,6,Erosion under outlet of pipe. Embankment fill erosion on left side of the outlet. No blockage issues.          ,1,5,5,11,"Massive culvert and outlet pool indicating the stream has high flows quite high flow drink time of survey and pipe was functioning. Well, unlikely a flood would affect the culvert but if it did, it would wash out highway 16.          ",10,2,1,1,10,4,28,39,"Highway crossing so construction would be expensive and difficult. 2024-10-07T20:15:27Z,,13900260,LS,,newgraph_lschick,13900260,newgraph_lschick,,413,Tributary to sugar bowl Creek          ,Hwy 16,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.2,50,"Inlet drop due to small debris jam at Inlet. Highway crossing with a large amount of fill therefore construction will be difficult and expensive. But thereâ€™s a massive outlet drop and the stream has lots of nice gravel and a steep grade, likely bull trout in the system. Would be a great candidate for a placement if possible. Repairing area outlet has been cleared due to powerlines overhead.          ",,2024-10-07,10,587916,5972449,No,,,No,,9,1.4,0.9,Yes,6,7,5,No,No,Deep Fill,High,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,3,1,1,5,"Outlet of pipe is quite perched with significant erosion under the pipe on the left side. Small debris jam at Inlet creating an inlet drop, no other blockage. And Bankman Phil is in good shape.          ",2,5,10,15," Size of the outlet pool indicates the culvert is significantly undersized for the size of the stream, a flood would likely affect the culvert. This could cause significant damage seeing as itâ€™s under Highway 16.          ",10,3,1,1,5,4,24,39," Highway crossing so expensive and difficult. Likely a fish bearing stream with lots of of nice gravel, likely bull trout in the system given the steepness of the stream. Environmental impact could be quite high due to construction.",ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_132059.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_132105.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_132600.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_132108.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_132102.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_132557.jpg,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_132112.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_144117.jpg,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-07T22:05:38Z,,13603617,LS,,newgraph_lschick,13603617,newgraph_lschick,,415,Tributary to Kenneth creek ,Bowron fsr,32,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.1,13,"Inlet of culvert, completely submerged, with big beaver pond area just upstream. Outlet of culvert plugwg up with beaver sticks, it looks like the beaver has damed it all the way through to create big pool at inlet. Culvert still has flow though. There is a beaver dam roughly 0.7m in height about 40m downstream of the culvert. There has been a new culvert installed that is 40 m north on the FSR, so flow from that crossing is entering the outlet pool from the north. Downstream of the culvert the stream flows through the forest with very little areas with define channel. Where there is a fine channel itâ€™s roughly 1-3m wide, but most of the time itâ€™s just 15-17m of wetted forrest with some flow. Culvert slope estimated due to submerged inlet. ",,2024-10-07,10,578664,5972996,No,,,No,,1.5,0,0.25,No,1.5,10.5,0.5,Yes,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,1,1,2,4,"Fever has plugged up the culvert, with lots of debris sticking out the outlet, culvert is jammed all the way through and creating a big pool at the inlet, with the inlet completely submerged          ",2,1,2,6,"Call Culver is quite small for the size of the stream, due to the beaver damming up the culvert, likely that a flood would wash out the road as thereâ€™s only a metre and a half of sale on top of the culvert. ",1,2,8,9,5,5,30,36,"The road FSR with not much sales so construction would be relatively easy and expensive. This is a trip to kenneth creek, which is a fish bearing stream so they like the fish in the system, therefore there could be environment impacts. ",ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_151212.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_151218.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_151225.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_151221.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_151214.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_151224.jpg,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_152149.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_164244.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_152204.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241007_164248.jpg,Other stream ,Downstream ,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-09T16:16:22Z,,22201229,LS,,newgraph_bute,22201229,newgraph_bute,,421,Holliday creek ,Hwy 16 ,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,4,52,"Although culver it big it is still likely undersized for the size of the stream. Lots of flow at time of survey. Significant outlet drop, especially at lower flows. Nice stream, likely a bull trout system. Several big boulders in outlet pool. Steep system. Fish (~60mm) observed during habitat confirmation. ",,2024-10-09,11,305946,5896010,No,,,No,,2,0.8,0.5,No,2,16,3,No,Yes,Deep Fill,High,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_bute,2,2,1,5,No blockages issues. Erosion of embankment fill on both sides of the culvert outlet. ,1,4,4,9,"Although pipe is big itâ€™s still undersized for the size of the stream, and could wash out in a flood. Highway crossing so flood would washout highway, only 2m of road fill. ",10,2,1,1,5,5,24,33,Likely a nice bull trout stream so there could be environment impacts due to construction. Highway crossing so expensive and difficult to fix. ,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_094337.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_094345.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_094356.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_094349.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_094340.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_094354.jpg,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_094400.jpg,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_104948.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_094404.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_104953.jpg,,Downstream,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-09T18:55:46Z,7620,,LS,,newgraph_bute,7620,newgraph_bute,,423,Teepee creek,Railway ,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,2.6,52,"Gate across inlet acting as a beaver grate. Lots of beaver activation. Downstream of culvert is a big beaver pond which is back watering the culvert. Beaver dam 50m downstream of the outlet. Super nice Nice stream after the beaver dam, low gradients. Stream is fenced perpendicular to the stream, both upstream and downstream, due to someone cattle land. Signs of cattle accessing stream near outlet. ",,2024-10-09,11,343425,5862437,Yes,0.1,Yes,Yes,100,7,0,1,No,1.5,7.5,1,Yes,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_bute,1,1,1,3,Gate across inlet to keep the beavers out. Not an issue for fish passage. Not erosion or fill issues. ,1,5,5,8,Unlikely flood would affect culvert but if it did it would wash out the railway. ,1,5,1,1,10,5,23,31,Railways crossing so expensive and difficult. 2024-10-09T20:35:50Z,,22201176,LS,,newgraph_bute,22201176,newgraph_bute,,426,Teepee creek ,Hwy 5,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.4,22,"Culvert is in good shape. Big deep outlet pool indicating the culvert is likely undersized for the size of the stream. Decent outlet drop at lower flows. Decent flow at time of survey. Really nice habitat downstream, lots of pools for overwintering fish and gravels for spawning. Frequent functional large woody debris creating complex habitat. Would highly recommend following up with electrofishing.hwy crossing so difficult. Small ford roughly 5m downstream of the culver outlet. ",,2024-10-09,11,344031,5862744,No,,,No,,0.7,0.4,1,No,2,7,2.5,No,No,Deep Fill,High,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_bute,2,1,1,4,"No blockage or fill issue. Not much fill anyways. Some erosion under outlet of pipe, due to it being undersized for the stream. ",3,5,15,19,Pipe is definitely undersized for the size of the stream and there is not much road fill making this crossing a significant hazard for a flood. Hwy crossing so a flood could wash out the road. ,10,5,1,1,10,5,32,51,Fish bearing stream with salmon point upstream. High priority to get fixed. Highway crossing so expensive. This crossing is also at high risk of flooding the highway so it should definitely get fixed. ,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_134840.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_134846.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_134854.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_134848.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_134842.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_134851.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_135430.jpg,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_135406.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_134902.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241009_134909.jpg,Downstream ,Cattle downstream ,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-09T21:07:02Z,4931,,LS,,newgraph_bute,4931,newgraph_bute,,426,Teepee creek ,Mt tinsley pit road,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.55,6,"Significant outlet drop. Pipe is in good condition but erosion under pipe outlet and road column on outlet side. Super nice stream with known fish in the system, salmon point downstream. Steep gradients at this crossing but crossing downstream on highway has low gradients and lots of nice gravels. Small dirt road with not much fill so replacement would be quite straight forward. ",,2024-10-09,11,344707,5862849,No,,,No,,0.5,1.3,0.35,No,5,5.6,12,No,No,Shallow Fill,High,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_bute,2,2,1,5,No blockage issue. Erosion under and around Pipe outlet. 2024-10-09T19:51:21Z,,22202142,AI,,newgraph_airvine,22202142,newgraph_airvine,,136,Teepee Creek ,Railway ,,CN Rail,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,2.7,14,"Three cocrete pipes at 0.9m each with two corrugated overflows above at 0.9m each. Stamp on structure is 1944. All three concrete pipes are clogged at the inlet ranging from 80% to 100% clogged with debris.

,,2024-10-09,11,344222,5862742,No,,,No,,2,0.75,0.25,Yes,6,4.2,7,No,No,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_airvine,1,1,3,5, All three inlet for the concrete pipes are clogged with debris ranging from 80% to 100% clogged. On the railway railway ballast is in good shape.,2,2,4,9, Railway has installed two overflow pipes above the three concrete pipes to manage high flow events, and with the ballast of the railway made of large angular cobble a flood event seems somewhat unlikely provided maintenance to the crossing is happening. Downstream there are residences before the highway, then some private residences down below. A blowout up here Domino down at the highway          ",1,10,3,2,10,8,34,43," On the railway, so potentially very difficult to replace the crossing without interrupting transport services to severely. Apparently opportunity costs of closing the railway are very high, which leads apparently to very little addressing of environmental issues by this private corporation.
